title: 'Voter IDs, chocolates ...': Amit Shah lists proof Pahalgam terrorists came from Pak
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced in Lok Sabha that security forces neutralized three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack during Operation Mahadev. The terrorists, identified as Suleman, Afghan, and Jibran, were A-category members of Lashkar-e-Taiba. Investigation involved questioning over a thousand individuals, creating composite sketches, and detaining those who provided food and shelter to the terrorists.

title: 'What if Duckett was on 90?: Ex-cricketer slams England over handshake drama
content: Parthiv Patel questions the 'spirit of the game' after England offered a handshake to India during the fourth Test, with Jadeja and Sundar nearing centuries. He wonders if England would have accepted a similar offer if Ben Duckett was close to his century. Patel supports India's decision to continue batting, emphasising their hard-earned position and the right to pursue milestones.

title: 'We have proof': Shah slams Chidambaram's 'homegrown' terrorists remark; asks whom does he want to save?
content: In a Lok Sabha showdown, Amit Shah strongly refuted P Chidambaram's doubts regarding Pakistan's role in the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor. Shah presented evidence, including NIA arrests and FSL reports, confirming the terrorists' identities and their Pakistani origin. He accused Chidambaram of giving Pakistan a clean chit and undermining the investigation.

title: Caught on cam: Woman reverses SUV into glass door at Bareilly hotel; panic erupts in lobby
content: In Bareilly, a woman accidentally crashed her SUV through the glass entrance of Hotel Ramada after dinner with her husband. While reversing, she mistakenly accelerated, causing the vehicle to surge backward. The SUV shattered the entrance and rammed into the reception area, creating chaos and property damage, though no injuries were reported.

title: TCS layoffs: Former Tech Mahindra CEO CP Gurnani quotes Sholay line
content: Amidst TCS layoffs, CP Gurnani urges the Indian tech industry to move beyond headcount obsession and embrace outcome-based models. He emphasizes a shift from the traditional pyramid structure, advocating for enhanced productivity, specialized skills, and advanced technological capabilities. Experts suggest that upskilling and reskilling are crucial for tech professionals in this evolving landscape.

title: 'Ill-timed': US shuns UN 2-state solution conference; conveys concerns with India
content: The United States has expressed reservations to India regarding the UN 2-state conference, deeming it counterproductive to ending the Gaza conflict and securing hostage releases. Despite US urging, India is participating, seeking constructive engagement towards a 2-state solution. India balances its ties with Israel and its support for the Palestinian cause, advocating for a negotiated resolution.

title: ‘Negotiations needed…’: Trump official on India-US trade; no deal before Aug 1?
content: India-US trade deal: Hopes for an imminent India-US trade deal are fading as a top American official indicates that more negotiations are needed before President Trump's August 1 tariff deadline. Despite ongoing discussions, disagreements persist, particularly in agriculture and dairy sectors, where India remains protective.

title: 'If you don't understand my silence ...': Fresh rift within Congress? Manish Tewari post adds to speculation
content: Congress MP Manish Tewari's cryptic social media posts have ignited speculation about internal divisions within the party, particularly regarding national security issues. His silence during a crucial Lok Sabha debate on Operation Sindoor, coupled with Shashi Tharoor's abstention and reported internal criticism, suggests a lack of unified stance within the Congress leadership.

title: Solar Eclipse that will see the "world to go dark for six minutes" on August 2
content: Contrary to viral claims, the world won't experience a six-minute blackout on August 2, 2025. NASA confirms a total solar eclipse will occur on August 2, 2027, darkening parts of Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ box office: Ahaan Panday, Aneet Padda film has a slow start on second Tuesday
content: Saiyaara continues its successful run at the box office, breaking records in its second week. Despite a minor drop on weekdays, the film earned Rs 30 crore on its second Sunday. Second Monday collections were Rs 9.25 crore, and Tuesday afternoon saw Rs 1.6 crore. The total collection now stands at Rs 258.17 crore.

title: 'Absolute filth, embarrassing moment': Stuart Broad on Harry Brook's over where he bowled 37mph
content: Stuart Broad criticized England's tactics during the fourth Test against India, particularly Harry Brook's off-spin bowling, labeling it "embarrassing." Ben Stokes's attempt to speed up the match's conclusion by using Brook and bringing fielders in close drew scrutiny. While opinions diverged, the incident highlights the tension and debate surrounding England's approach as the series heads to a decisive final Test.

title: Accenture executive says AI can speed up work, but won’t raise productivity unless…
content: Artificial Intelligence tools can speed up tasks. However, Accenture's Ramine Tinati says it doesn't guarantee productivity. Companies need to redesign workflows for real gains. Some Asian firms are lagging in AI adoption. Tech giants like Amazon and Microsoft are investing heavily in AI. Nvidia's Jensen Huang and OpenAI's Sam Altman believe AI will change jobs.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Why not declare after Ben Stokes' hundred?' - Sunil Gavaskar slams England's 'loud talk'
content: The drawn Test match between India and England saw heated exchanges. Sunil Gavaskar has now criticized England's tactics. He praised India's resilience, especially Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar's batting. Gavaskar questioned England's delayed declaration. He also referenced past comments from England players about chasing high scores. Gavaskar challenged Shubman Gill to question England's strategy in the post-match conference.

title: TCS layoffs: IT ministry ‘closely monitoring’ 12k job cuts, claims report
content: India's IT Ministry is closely monitoring TCS's plan to reduce its workforce by over 12,000 employees, primarily impacting middle and senior management. This restructuring, representing two percent of TCS's global staff, is part of a strategy to become a "future-ready organisation.

title: NFL under pressure to review safety measures after New York shooting; 5 killed; league faces calls for urgent action
content: A gunman's deadly rampage at the NFL's New York headquarters triggered a lockdown and claimed a police officer's life, shaking the league's operations. While no players or executives were harmed, the incident prompted immediate security enhancements and internal discussions about the future of the NFL's presence in Midtown Manhattan, including exploring options like remote work and relocation.

title: RBI bets on gold! Central Bank buys half a tonne of gold in June
content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) increased its gold reserves by approximately half a tonne in late June, bringing total holdings to 879.8 tonnes. Gold's value within India's foreign exchange reserves has significantly increased, reaching 12.1% as of July 18, 2025.

title: Exited BMW, rifle in hand, began firing in lobby: How Manhattan shooting unfolded
content: A lone gunman, Shane Tamura, unleashed terror in Midtown Manhattan, resulting in five fatalities, including a brave police officer. Tamura, who drove from Las Vegas, initiated the carnage in a Park Avenue building, fatally shooting the officer in the lobby. He then continued his rampage, killing civilians before taking his own life on the 33rd floor.

title: Erin Burnett comes under fire: CNN anchor misidentifies shooter as “possibly white”; Sparks backlash over premature racial speculation
content: Erin Burnett, a CNN anchor, faces criticism for identifying the Park Avenue shooter as "possibly white" during a live broadcast, contradicting initial NYPD reports describing him as "possibly Middle Eastern." This sparked a social media backlash, raising concerns about racial assumptions and media responsibility in real-time news coverage. The shooter, Shane D. Tamura, killed four before fatally shooting himself.

title: Chinese company banned in America launches rival to Nvidia’s most-advanced chip
content: Huawei's CloudMatrix 384, showcased at WAIC Shanghai, is emerging as a strong competitor to Nvidia's GB200 NVL72. Despite U.S. restrictions, Huawei is becoming a key Chinese AI chip supplier. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang acknowledged Huawei's progress and warned about the impact of U.S. curbs, suggesting Huawei could dominate if restrictions persist.

title: 'Event management': Congress questions timing of 'Op Mahadev'; asks why not earlier?
content: Congress leader Udit Raj questioned the timing of the Pahalgam attack mastermind's encounter, suggesting it was orchestrated to coincide with the Parliament debate on Operation Sindoor. He speculated the terrorist was already in custody and the army was instructed to delay action for "event management.

title: Jharkhand accident: 5 Kanwariyas dead, 23 hurt in bus-truck collision; CM expresses grief
content: A tragic accident occurred in Deoghar's Mohanpur block. A bus carrying Kanwariyas collided with a truck. The collision resulted in the death of six pilgrims. Twenty-four others sustained serious injuries. The accident took place near Jamuniya forest. Rescue operations are underway. Injured individuals are receiving medical treatment at nearby facilities. Authorities are investigating the incident.

title: Who was Shane Tamura? What we know about the Manhattan building shooter
content: A tragic shooting at a Midtown Manhattan office building on Park Avenue resulted in five fatalities, including an NYPD officer and the suspected gunman, Shane Tamura. Tamura, armed with an AR-15-style rifle, opened fire in the building's lobby before taking his own life.

title: Birth in space: What happens if a baby is born beyond Earth; risks of pregnancy in orbit
content: The possibility of human reproduction in space raises significant biological and technological challenges. Microgravity impacts fetal development and poses logistical difficulties for childbirth, while cosmic radiation threatens DNA and increases the risk of miscarriage and developmental abnormalities. Protecting against radiation and understanding the effects of weightlessness on fetal and infant development are crucial before attempting space pregnancy.

title: Wankhede Stadium heist: IPL jerseys worth Rs 6.5L stolen from BCCI office; security guard held
content: A security guard at the BCCI office in Mumbai has been arrested for allegedly stealing 261 IPL jerseys, valued at Rs 6.52 lakh. Farooque Aslam Khan, the accused, reportedly sold the jerseys to an online dealer to fund his online gambling addiction.

title: Priya Dutt shares pics of brother Sanjay Dutt on his birthday, writes, “We fight, we laugh, and we cry together..”
content: Sanjay Dutt celebrated his 66th birthday, receiving warm wishes from family and fans. His sister, Priya Dutt, shared nostalgic photos and a heartfelt message of love and support. Maanayata Dutt posted a touching video montage of their cherished moments, expressing gratitude for his strength, love, and guidance, followed by a cozy family dinner and cake-cutting ceremony.

title: Op Mahadev: Pahalgam attack mastermind among 3 terrorists killed, says report - what we know
content: In Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, security forces neutralized three terrorists in an intense firefight near Dachigam National Park. The operation, dubbed "Operation Mahadev," follows reports linking the terrorists to the April 22 Pahalgam attack, where numerous tourists and a local resident were killed.

title: Delhi weather update: Heavy rain lashes capital; Air India warns of flight disruptions
content: Heavy rain and strong winds disrupted daily life in New Delhi, causing significant waterlogging and traffic congestion on major roads. Airlines issued travel advisories, cautioning passengers about potential delays, although no major flight disruptions were reported. The IMD predicted continued rainfall, but no color-coded alert was issued.

title: Tensions escalate at Sona BLW: Cease-and-desist notice issued to Rani Kapur
content: Sona BLW Precision Forgings has issued a cease-and-desist notice to Rani Kapur, Sunjay Kapur's mother, over alleged defamatory information. The company refutes her claims of mismanagement and coercion, highlighting its professional management and independent board. Rani Kapur, who isn't a shareholder, plans to respond legally, while the company emphasizes transparency and adherence to corporate governance post-Sunjay's death.

title: NASA grows plants in space: Key to astronaut health; Mars and deep space travel breakthrough
content: Growing plants in space, once a distant dream, is now vital for long-duration missions. Astronauts have successfully cultivated zinnias, sunflowers, and wheat on space stations, offering fresh food, psychological comfort, and life-support benefits. NASA's Veggie project and earlier Soviet experiments demonstrate the feasibility of space farming, paving the way for sustainable deep space exploration and reducing reliance on Earth-based supplies.

title: India playing XI: Kuldeep in the mix, Akash Deep likely to return; call on Bumrah soon
content: With the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy still alive and series on the line, India are expected to veer from its safety-first approach in the fifth Test, starting Thursday at The Oval, and go all-out for the kill to level the series. Bumrah's participation remains uncertain and the question marks over Shardul Thakur or Kuldeep Yadav persists. On the batting front, Dhruv Jurel replaces the injured Rishabh Pant.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are gold rates headed ahead of US tariff deadline?
content: Gold price prediction: Gold prices are fluctuating within a range due to decreased demand for safe-haven assets as global economic uncertainties lessen with trade deals. The US-EU trade agreement, while criticized by some, has reduced market uncertainty. Investors are closely watching US-China trade talks and the upcoming FOMC decision for further direction, with a slightly bearish outlook for gold in the near term.

title: Caitlin Clark’s stalker sentenced to prison: Pleads guilty to stalking & harassment
content: Michael Lewis, Caitlin Clark's stalker, received a 2.5-year prison sentence for sending threatening and sexually explicit messages. Despite claiming he only wanted Clark's safety, his numerous social media posts and proximity to the Gainbridge Fieldhouse led to his arrest. Clark's courage in pursuing the case was praised, highlighting the importance of standing up against online harassment.

title: IND vs ENG: The swordsman vs The showman – Jadeja or Stokes, who stands taller?
content: The Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series highlights the contrasting yet compelling rivalry between Ben Stokes and Ravindra Jadeja. While Stokes is celebrated for his match-winning performances in high-pressure situations, Jadeja's consistent all-round contributions often go unnoticed. Despite Stokes' impactful bowling in the series, Jadeja's superior batting and overall value have sparked debate about who is the better all-rounder.

title: NFL headquarters shooting: Police respond to shocking shooter rampage in Midtown Manhattan
content: A mass shooting at 345 Park Avenue in Midtown Manhattan, home to the NFL headquarters and other major firms, left four dead, including a police officer. The alleged gunman, Shane Devon Tamura, 27, of Las Vegas, used an AR-15-style rifle before fatally shooting himself. The incident has sparked concerns about gun control and security in high-profile urban buildings.

title: Himachal rain fury: Mandi flash flood kills 3; Chandigarh–Manali highway blocked
content: A flash flood in Mandi town, triggered by a cloudburst, has claimed at least three lives and caused extensive damage to houses and vehicles. The Chandigarh-Manali highway is blocked due to landslides, exacerbating the situation. Rescue operations are underway as authorities assess the full extent of the devastation, with one person still missing.

title: 'Used furniture to block door': Witnesses recall terrifying moments during Manhattan shooting
content: A shooting in Midtown Manhattan resulted in the deaths of five people, including a police officer and the suspected gunman, Shane Tamura. The incident occurred inside an office building, reportedly housing Blackstone investment company, causing widespread panic as the shooter moved floor by floor. Police have contained the scene, confirming the shooter is dead, while investigations are underway.

title: Hit and run: Thar driver reverses to target elderly after minor collision in Jammu; flees
content: In Jammu, a young man, Manan Anand, has been booked for allegedly hitting an elderly man after their vehicles collided. CCTV footage shows Anand driving recklessly before the initial collision, after which he intentionally reversed his Mahindra Thar to strike the victim again near Allora Textiles.

title: Chess | The banana survives in Batumi; India gets its first-ever Women's World Cup champion in Divya Deshmukh
content: In a historic win at Batumi, Georgia, 19-year-old Divya Deshmukh clinched India's first-ever Women’s World Cup chess title, defeating Grandmaster Koneru Humpy. The intense final saw Divya, playing with black pieces, triumph in a rapid tie-break. Amidst the drama, an untouched banana served as her quirky companion, a constant presence throughout her victorious journey.

title: Engineer jumps to death from Pune office building; leaves heartbreaking note
content: In Pune, a 23-year-old mechanical engineer died after jumping from his office building. The incident happened in Hinjewadi. The engineer worked for a technology company. Police recovered a note from the body. The note suggested personal struggles. He was from Nashik and had been working at the company for a year.

title: US may axe OPT, threatening Indian students: Can America’s tech sector absorb shock? What it means
content: A Republican-led bill, H.R. 2315, aims to eliminate the OPT programme, jeopardising post-study work rights for international students—especially Indians, who dominate STEM-OPT participation. Critics call it a “job theft” loophole, but data shows OPT fuels U.S. innovation, university funding, and tech firms. Killing it could gut America’s global talent pipeline—and its competitive edge.

title: 'At Lord's, the same happened' - Nasser Hussain reveals how Stokes fires up Archer
content: England captain Ben Stokes' leadership, especially his handling of Jofra Archer, has garnered praise amidst the ongoing Test series against India. Former skipper Nasser Hussain highlighted the trust and chemistry between Stokes and Archer, noting Stokes' ability to motivate Archer effectively. The final Test vs India starts on July 31.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 80,900
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was near 24,700, BSE Sensex was hovering near 80,900.

title: Manipur preparing for Special Intensive Revision, says Joint CEO
content: BLO training, meetings with political parties underway; Joint CEO adds no specific timelines have been communicated for SIR in Manipur

title: Actor Raveendran withdraws his nomination for AMMA president post
content: However, he will contest for the post of general secretary in the election for the executive committee of the association to be held on August 15

title: Around 74% of 1,087 monitored wells in Karnataka registered rise in groundwater level: Jal Shakti Ministry
content: Over 16.66 lakh water conservation and artificial recharge structures were constructed or renovated in Karnataka since 2021 under various initiatives of the Central and State governments

title: BJP in Kerala defends ‘mistaken’ arrests of nuns in Chhattisgarh, distances itself from Bajrang Dal
content: Rajeev Chandrasekhar says the two nuns were ‘not human traffickers or proselytisers’ as accused by Bajrang Dal activists in Chhattisgarh and that Bajrang Dal does not bear BJP’s imprimatur and is an independent organisation

title: NIA launches probe into killing of Pahalgam attack mastermind in Srinagar encounter
content: The Army's elite para commandos on July 28 claimed to have gunned down Sulieman alias Asif, the alleged mastermind of the April 22 attack

title: Dharmasthala burials: Process of exhuming bodies begins
content: On July 28, the complainant showed 13 spots where bodies have allegedly been buried, around the bathing ghat in Dharmasthala, to the SIT personnel

title: Panneerselvam shifts stance, condemns BJP over Samagra Shiksha funds controversy
content: Ever since Mr. Panneerselvam rebelled against the AIADMK’s former interim general secretary V.K. Sasikala in February 2017, he had been known as a staunch ally of the BJP

title: Delegations of LDF, UDF head to Chhattisgarh to champion cause of arrested Keralite nuns
content: Controversial arrests, which prompted bipartisan protests in Kerala, occurred after Bajrang Dal workers mobbed the two nuns at a railway station, accusing them of spiriting away three women, including a tribal community member, to Agra for conversion

title: Private school correspondent arrested for impregnating Class X student in Konaseema
content: The accused has allegedly raped the victim about five months ago; The incident came to light during a medical health check-up.

title: Rahul Gandhi to sponsor education of 22 children who lost parents in Pakistan shelling during Operation Sindoor
content: Poonch district alone accounted for 13 civilian deaths among 28 fatalities in the Pakistani shelling and drone attacks in Jammu and Kashmir

title: Golden disc and conch donated to Tirumala temple
content: The value of the precious donation which weighed 2.5 kilograms is approximately pegged around ₹2.40 crore.

title: Deleted, not denied: The truth behind Kanthapuram’s claim on Nimisha Priya’s reprieve
content: When ANI deleted an original tweet on Nimisha Priya’s reprieve, it automatically disappeared from Kanthapuram Aboobacker Musliar’s X handle, leading to confusions and speculations about the Malayali nurse’s fate in Yemen

title: Gogoi's Parliament speech proves he acts on behalf of Pakistan: Himanta
content: His (Gaurav Gogoi) secret trip and close ties with the Pakistani establishment speak volumes, says Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Expedite investigation, trial in 37 cases pending against ‘Savukku’ Shankar: Madras High Court
content: Justice P. Velmurugan orders completion of investigation within four months in 13 cases and completion of trial within six months in 24 other cases

title: Three terrorists who carried out Pahalgam terror attack killed: Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah said that the three terrorists have been identified as Suleiman, Jibran and Afghan Bhai, all Pakistani nationals, and they were tracked with the help of human and technical intelligence in an operation led by the Intelligence Bureau, Army, Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) and J&K police.

title: Maratha reservation: Jarange warns of fresh hunger strike on August 29
content: Four major demands of the Marathas, which the government assured would be implemented, have not been fulfilled. The government has once again deceived the community, says Reservation activist Manoj Jarange

title: Google urged to set up a Chip Designing Centre in Visakhapatnam
content: During his third visit to Singapore on Tuesday (July 29, 2025), Minister Nara Lokesh met  Google Cloud Director Drew Brynes.

title: National Herald case: Court defers order on cognisance of ED charge sheet
content: Earlier on July 15, Special judge Vishal Gogne had reserved the order for July 29 after noting that the submissions on the aspect of cognisance had been concluded.

title: Lokesh invites ST Telemedia to establish Green Energy Data Centre in Visakhapatnam
content: During the meeting, Mr. Lokesh urged the company to establish a Green Energy-Powered Data Center in Visakhapatnam, which is being developed as a dedicated Data City in Andhra Pradesh.

title: Idol vandalised in Uttar Pradesh’s Sonbhadra temple; police register FIR
content: A case has been registered at the Robertsganj police station, and efforts are underway to identify and arrest the accused

title: Pregnant women taken on bullock cart, cot through slushy roads after heavy rains in Madhya Pradesh
content: Two such cases of pregnant women bearing the brunt of poor roads due to overflowing rivers and streams have come to the fore in the last few days

title: Breaking new ground in Tamil storytelling: from YouTube Originals to TV serials
content: With increasing mobile viewership, direct access to global audiences, and monetisation tools like advertisements, production houses like Radaan are creating original content with storylines tailored for the new-age audience

title: NCLT allows Jagan’s plea to cancel transfer of Saraswati Power shares to sister, mother
content: Mr. Jagan, Ms. Bharati and Ms. Vijayamma hold about 74.26 lakh (29.88%), 41 lakh ( 16.30%) and 1.22 crore shares (48.99%), respectively, in Saraswati Power, while the rest is with Classic Realty Pvt. Ltd.

title: Govindachamy’s jailbreak: DIG report confirms security lapses at Kannur jail
content: Findings submitted by DIG of Prisons (North Zone) V. Jayakumar to Director General of Prisons and Correctional Services Balaram Kumar Upadhyay underline systematic failures in surveillance, staffing and prison infrastructure

title: Will immediately intervene, if draft Bihar electoral roll shows ‘mass exclusion’, says Supreme Court
content: Supreme Court fixes the next hearing on Bihar Special Intensive Revision exercise pleas on August 12 and August 13, indicating the Court would primarily deal with issues regarding the draft electoral roll

title: Odisha Police rescues 28-day-old infant allegedly sold by parents
content: Police rescued the infant from the house of a couple at Paikamal in neighbouring Bargarh district and handed it over to the Child Welfare Committee

title: Faced online abuse for years, but rape threats are a new low: Actor Ramya
content: Amidst the ongoing Renukaswamy murder case involving Darshan, actor Ramya speaks out against online trolling from fans of the Kannada star, urging action to prevent further harassment

title: Maharashtra to felicitate Chess Grandmaster Divya Deshmukh for FIDE women World Cup victory
content: From Prime Minister Narendra Modi to Opposition leader Rahul Gandhi congratulated her for massive victory.

title: On Nivin Pauly’s petition, producer booked for allegedly forging rights of Action Hero Biju 2
content: Nivin Pauly is also the co-producer of the film, which is a sequel to blockbuster Malayalam movie ‘Action Hero Biju’

title: Three killed, one missing as flash flood wreaks havoc in Himachal's Mandi
content: The Chandigarh-Manali National Highway has been closed at 4 Mile, 9 Mile and Dwada as the road stretches have been washed away.

title: Lucknow Court grants custody of Chhangur baba to Enforcement Directorate for five days
content: Chhangur Baba and three other people were arrested by the U.P. Police’s Anti-Terrorism Squad on July 5

title: A.P. CM Chandrababu Naidu proposes training and innovation partnership with ‘AI Singapore’
content: ‘Empowering our students with emerging technologies like AI is not just an investment in skills, but a foundation for long-term innovation and economic growth,’ says CM Chandrababu Naidu

title: Six Kanwariyas killed, 24 injured in bus-truck collision in Jharkhand
content: The accident occurred near the Jamuniya forest under the Mohanpur Police Station limits around 4.30 am when the bus collided with the vehicle

title: Andhra Pradesh government signs MoU to set up Creator Academy
content: The MoU was formalised in the presence of Andhra Pradesh Minister for Education, IT, and Electronics, Nara Lokesh, during a special event held in Singapore on Tuesday (January 29, 2025).

title: Supreme Court collegium recommends names for judgeship in six High Courts
content: The three-member collegium meeting headed by Chief Justice B.R. Gavai approved the proposal for appointment of judicial officer Vimal Kumar Yadav as a judge of the Delhi High Court

title: Supreme Court hearing on Presidential Reference highlights: Constitution Bench to commence hearing from August 19
content: Chief Justice B.R. Gavai gives Senior Advocates K.K. Venugopal and A.M. Singhvi an hour to argue on the maintainability of the Reference.

title: PM’s ‘shameful silence’ on Israel’s assault on people of Gaza height of ‘moral cowardice’, says Sonia Gandhi
content: Congress parliamentary party chairperson Sonia Gandhi slammed the Modi government for being a "mute spectator to this affront to humanity", and said this was a "cowardly betrayal of our constitutional values".

title: 'Just a top-shelf human being': Teammates, opponents remember Ryne Sandberg
content: Beloved on and off the field, Sandberg leaves a lasting legacy in Chicago and throughout the baseball universe.

title: Cubs Hall of Famer Sandberg dies at age 65
content: Ryne Sandberg, a Hall of Fame second baseman who spent nearly all of his playing career with the Cubs, died Monday after a recurrence of cancer.

title: NFL employee seriously injured in NYC shooting
content: A National Football League employee was seriously injured in a shooting Monday at a midtown Manhattan building that houses the NFL's offices and some of the country's top financial firms, commissioner Roger Goodell said in a memo to employees.

title: 'It was a no-brainer': Paul celebrated in L.A. return
content: Eight years after he last played for the franchise, Chris Paul was reintroduced as a member of the Clippers on Monday, calling his return to Los Angeles a "no-brainer."

title: D-backs 3B Suárez hit on hand, X-rays negative
content: D-backs All-Star Eugenio Suárez hopes he avoided a major injury when he was hit on the right index finger by a pitch on Monday.

title: Deion says he's cancer-free after bladder removal
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders said he recently had surgery to remove his bladder after doctors found a tumor there, and he declared that he has been cancer-free since the operation.

title: Sources: Harper cussed out Manfred in meeting
content: Bryce Harper told MLB commissioner Rob Manfred to "get the f--- out of our clubhouse" during a meeting with the Phillies about the game's economics, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: Raiders player offended by Wilkins' kiss
content: Christian Wilkins, who was released by the Raiders on Thursday, kissed a fellow player on the head and the teammate took offense to it, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Source: Dallas' Guyton (knee) out, but ACL intact
content: An MRI revealed that Cowboys left tackle Tyler Guyton suffered a bone fracture -- not a torn ACL -- in his right knee during Monday's practice. He will sit out four to six weeks, but the injury will not require surgery.

title: 💍 Haliburton proposes to girlfriend Jade Jones
content: Haliburton staged the proposal inside Hilton Coliseum on the Iowa State campus, where the couple began dating.

title: Updated ranking of MLB's top 50 trade deadline candidates: New names added
content: Our running list of who could be traded has some big changes in the final few days before the July 31 deadline.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Why Mets could trade Vientos
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: WNBA trades we want to see: Mabrey to Storm, Hines-Allen to Fever
content: Marina Mabrey, Aaliyah Edwards and Myisha Hines-Allen could be on the move before the WNBA trade deadline.

title: Who will start for the Browns and Colts in Week 1? We made QB battle predictions
content: We talked to sources to help project open QB1 races in Cleveland, Indianapolis, New Orleans and New York.

title: Can Ashton Jeanty deliver on the hype? Those who've watched his career have no doubt
content: Ashton Jeanty started turning heads as a 14-year-old in Naples, Italy. His coaches, teammates and even his opponents have been witnesses to his rise.

title: Pelton's NBA offseason grades: Who aced their summer -- and who got the only 'F'
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: Ranking every prospect dealt before the 2025 MLB trade deadline
content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

title: 'Everybody just died laughing': Teammates, opponents on what makes Ichiro a Hall of Fame icon
content: As a Mariners icon gets his Cooperstown call, teammates and opponents share what makes him 100% Hall of Fame worthy.

title: Pérez: What it was like to play with three 2025 HOFers
content: Eduardo Pérez believes this year's inductees are more than great players -- their hearts and characters stand out.

title: 'It's about standards and details': Man United, Amorim aiming to start anew
content: Refreshed as Manchester United begin their U.S. preseason tour, Ruben Amorim finally has the time to implement the changes he feels will turn the club around.

title: Don't stop believing: The inside story of how England won Euro 2025
content: Late heroics, Reggie the dog and a new team mantra. Here's the inside story of how England won the 2025 European Championship.

title: Cincy on the up after tight draw vs. Messi-less Miami
content: Cincinnati is looking like one of the league's best again after taking the fight to Miami, climbing the latest edition of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: All-SEC Final Four? 100 predictions, more at 100 days until women's hoops
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Why Liverpool still want Alexander Isak amid massive summer spending
content: Liverpool's pursuit of Alexander Isak amid a summer of big spending isn't about being better this season but about future-proofing the team so that they're ready for life beyond Mo Salah.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle eye Jackson to replace Liverpool-linked Isak
content: Newcastle's interest in Nicolas Jackson could open the way for Alexander Isak to join Liverpool. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: Nimisha Priya case: MEA refutes reports on death sentence revoked
content: On July 28, 2025, office of Sunni leader Kanthapuram A.P. Aboobacker Musliar claimed that the execution has been revoked by the Houthi militia

title: Rain might have washed it away, says Meghalaya Minister after 4,000 tonnes of coal go missing
content: The High Court has directed the State government to take action against officials under whose watch the coal went missing.

title: What is Maharashtra’s new security Bill? | Explained
content: What does the Maharashtra Special Public Security Bill entail? How does it propose to counter ‘urban Naxals’? Which other States have similar laws? Which party opposed the Bill in the State’s Legislative Assembly? What are the main objections being raised against the Bill by civil rights activists?

title: TGCHE leads English curriculum revision on NEP 2020 lines
content: The revision will focus on less content, but with clear concepts and useful skills, or “light but tight” idea

title: ‘Every city in the country needs a HYDRAA’
content: One year on, the Hyderabad Disaster Response & Asset Protection Agency’s bulldozer image has masked a larger mission to reclaim lakes, restore public trust and reshape Hyderabad’s urban future. The institution’s chief defends tough crackdowns, explains legal strategy and outlines why demolition is just one part of the bigger picture

title: Anakaputhur, a former weavers’ colony, now on the verge of development
content: The famous Real Madras Handkerchief, Bleeding Madras and Madras Checks came from the handlooms of this village near Pallavaram

title: India has world’s highest number of slum clusters in flood-prone areas
content: A new study has found that more than 158 million slum-dwellers in India live in vulnerable settlements in floodplains, with most of them concentrated in the Ganga river delta

title: Magnitude 6.5 earthquake hits Nicobar Islands, no tsunami alert
content: The quake struck at a depth of 10 kilometres at 12 minutes past midnight local time, 259 kilometers west-northwest of Sabang, in western Indonesia’s Aceh

title: Haridwar stampede: Pushkar Singh Dhami directs to form a high-level committee for crowd management at Uttarakhand shrines
content: Chief Minister also stressed that the committee must work on minute details like studying the carrying capacity of the shrines and even nearby areas

title: Beed sarpanch murder case: Court rejects Walmik Karad’s discharge plea
content: The prosecution in the court argued that accused Walmik Karad conspired with co-accused persons, demanding a ransom of ₹2 crores from the officials of the company Avaada Energy Private Ltd

title: NSCN faction says Assam eviction drive planned to grab Naga ancestral lands
content: The outfit says the areas targeted were fictitiously marked ‘disturbed area belt’, citing demarcations by the British, who transferred these areas for administrative convenience

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) delegation meets Governor, demands removal of ‘corrupt’ Ministers
content: The delegation submitted a memorandum to the governor, underlining several incidents of misconduct by Ministers in the State Cabinet and provided evidence

title: Ceasefire between India and Pakistan had no linkage with U.S. trade: Jaishankar in Parliament
content: There was no call between the Prime Minister and President Trump from April 22 – when President Trump called up to convey his sympathy – and June 17, says Jaishankar

title: DMK has failed in its duty and surrendered to the BJP: Vijay
content: He says the Centre has sidelined Tamil Nadu, but now Prime Minister Narendra Modi is announcing statues for Chola kings and “taking lessons” from the Chola dynasty

title: Mamata asks migrants harassed in other States to return to West Bengal
content: Earlier in the day, during an administrative meeting West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee proposed to include migrant workers who returned to the state after 100 days of work under MGNREGA

title: Set for a record: paddy procurement in Tamil Nadu likely to touch 45-lakh-tonne mark soon
content: As of now, 44.49 lakh tonnes have been procured. With the State procuring an average of about 15,000 tonnes from farmers on a daily basis, the current high of 44.95 lakh tonnes, collected in 2020-21, will be crossed in a few days

title: Yemen revokes Nimisha Priya’s death sentence, claims Kanthapuram
content: Indian official sources, however, refused to confirm the claim so far saying the case is complex as the victim’s family had not reached a consensus on pardoning Nimisha Priya

title: Bus fare subsidy helps women save 30-50% on transport costs, increase edu spending: Study
content: The report revealed that in cities such as Nagpur and Pune, where fare subsidies apply primarily to intercity or long-distance routes, average monthly savings range from ₹409 to ₹538

title: Namma Metro opens new gate at Majestic for direct access to KSRTC outstation buses
content: This is part of BMRCL’s larger initiative to boost last-mile connectivity and enable seamless multi-modal transport integration in Bengaluru

title: Farmers in Punjab stage demonstration under KMM banner against Govt’s land pooling policy; Akali Dal also protests
content: Shiromani Akali Dal members staged a protest rally in Mohali against the land pooling policy. The party announced to hold another demonstration rally in Bathinda on August 4

title: Nuns are innocent, say family members of tribal women
content: Arrest of Keralite nuns in Chhattisgarh trigger protests; siblings of the purported victims reject allegations of trafficking and forcible conversion; they say the tribal women were accompanying the nuns to Agra for a job with the consent of family members; Chhattisgarh Chief Minister defends arrest

title: CS instructs officials not to appoint teachers to revise voters’ list in Karnataka
content: Shalini Rajneesh has instructed officials to appoint non-teaching staff, officers, and staff members working in various departments on priority basis for the task of revising the voters’ list

title: India, Japan officials meet, discuss PM’s visit, bullet train project
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is expected to visit India for the Quad Summit, along with U.S. President Donald Trump and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, later this year

title: Andhra Pradesh sees a fall in seroprevalence of Hepatitis B, says nodal officer
content: World Hepatitis Day is observed on July 28 to raise awareness on the liver infection caused by five types of viruses A, B, C, D and E; sex workers, drug users and those who get tattoos are generally considered to be at higher risk

title: Centre should abandon security-centric approach, engage in dialogue to resolve J&K issues: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Speaking at the PDP’s 26th foundation day event, she says Centre should restore trust of the people by engaging in a process that respects their dignity and rights

title: Google officials depose before ED in online betting linked PMLA case
content: The agency may also record the statement of a designated "compliance officer" of Google under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) apart from obtaining some documents from the company

title: Nuns to stay, serve in Gaza despite attacks, says Missionaries of Charity
content: The Missionaries of Charity has served in multiple conflict zones in the world, including in Gaza; the organisation said that the nuns “have been there from the beginning of the conflict”

title: Only by acknowledging diversity can India progress, says D. Raja
content: Releasing the book Kaalamthorum Communists, he urges communists to work closely with Periyarists and Ambedkarists to liberate people from exploitation and inequality

title: Issue of advocate casting allegation against Justice Swaminathan goes to CJ
content: A Division Bench of Justices G.R. Swaminathan and K. Rajasekar said advocate Vanchinathan had been giving interviews to YouTube Channels accusing the judge of caste bias

title: Indian-Origin Delta Pilot Arrested From Cockpit 10 Minutes After Landing
content: A Delta Airlines co-pilot was arrested 10 minutes after his flight landed at San Francisco International Airport on Sunday at around 7:05 am IST. Rustom Bhagwagar, 34, was taken into custody on charges of child sexual assault.

title: "No Homegrown Terrorists Left," Amit Shah Tells Parliament: Top Quotes
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah slammed the Opposition for criticising the government a day after security forces carried out 'Operation Mahadev' and eliminated three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack.

title: Key Member Of Drug Syndicate, On The Run For 3 Years, Arrested From Chennai
content: With the arrest of Siluvairaj, the Narcotics Control Bureau believes it has netted a crucial link in the international drug pipeline operating out of Tamil Nadu's coastal belt.

title: 2 Dead, 2 Missing In Rain Furry In Himachal's Mandi
content: Two people died, and two others were missing in Mandi on Tuesday due to continuous rainfall overnight, which caused extensive flooding and landslides throughout Himachal Pradesh.

title: "Pak Is Wife After Op Sindoor, Bring Her Home": Rajasthan MP's ROFL Speech
content: On a day of sharp exchanges between the opposition and treasury benches during the Operation Sindoor debate in Parliament, there were some moments of comic relief in the Lok Sabha when leaders on both sides of the political aisle laughed out loud.

title: 16 Killed In Russian Strike On Ukraine Prison Amid US' Demand For Ceasefire
content: A Russian strike on a prison in central Ukraine overnight killed more than 16 people and wounded dozens others, Kyiv said Monday, after Washington pressured Russia to end its war.

title: Opinion: Opinion | How Many Dead Babies Does A War Need?
content: Given New Delhi's historical support for Palestine, its supposed 'neutrality' today in the face of death, starvation, and genocide, citing a strategic relationship with Israel, is incongruous.

title: How Terrorists Killed In Op Mahadev Were Identified As Pahalgam Attackers
content: The recovery of foreign-made weapons from terrorists killed in a military operation yesterday has provided the Indian forces with undeniable evidence of an international conspiracy behind the terror impetus in Jammu and Kashmir, sources have said.

title: Bihar Assembly Premises, Patna Junction Waterlogged Amid Heavy Rainfall
content: Vehicular traffic was severely affected as people waded through the inundated streets with submerged cars and trucks.

title: Jaipur Receives Heaviest One-Day Rainfall, Breaks Decade Long-Record
content: Jaipur witnessed its heaviest one-day rainfall in 10 years on Tuesday. The city recorded 111 mm (over four inches) of rain at JLN Marg. Other parts of the city also saw significant rainfall.

title: 2015 Video Of New York Shooter Shane Tamura Goes Viral
content: Four people were killed and one critically injured when a man opened fire inside a Manhattan office building on Monday evening. The shooter, now identified as 27-year-old Shane Tamura, was later found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

title: International Tiger Day 2025: Home To 3,682 Tigers, India Now Global Leader In Tiger Conservation
content: India has achieved remarkable success in tiger conservation, and it's home to 3,682 large cats, Union Cabinet Minister for Environment, Forests, and Climate Change Bhupender Yadav said on Tuesday.

title: "Fabricated": Delhi Cops Reject Mamata Banerjee's Assault Claim On Bengalis
content: The Delhi Police on Monday called a video shared by West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on social media, alleging that a Bengali-speaking woman and her child were assaulted in the national capital for speaking their language, "fabricated".

title: Video: Delhi's Connaught Place, Other Areas Flooded After Heavy Rain
content: Videos circulating on social media showed a flooded Connaught Place with scooters and cars wading through knee-deep water.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 7 Live Updates: 1,000 People Interrogated In Pahalgam Probe: Amit Shah To Lok Sabha
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will open 16-hour long special discussion on the Operation Sindoor in the Rajya Sabha today.

title: Unclaimed Deposits With Banks Stand At Rs 67,003 Crore: Minister
content: Unclaimed deposits with banks, including private lenders, stood at Rs 67,003 crore at the end of June 2025, Parliament was informed on Monday.

title: Audi, Fortuner, Thar: 57 Vehicles Stolen From Delhi, UP, Haryana Found In Arunachal
content: The police in Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar on Monday dismantled a major inter-state vehicle theft and recovered 57 high-end stolen cars valued at over Rs 30 crore. The police also arrested the five key accused.

title: Heavy Rainfall In Delhi-NCR Brings Much-Needed Relief, Air Quality Improves
